original: Åkesson, Nils Hjalmar, bankdirektör, Falköping, f. 26/6/90 i Nevitshög, Malmöh. 1., av Åke Nilsson o. Kerstin Jönsson. G. 18 m. Kerstin Andersson, d. 33. Barn: Åke f. 20, jur. kand. — Stud:ex. i Lund 12. Anst. v. Skand. Kredit A-B 12-17, v. A-B Ind :banken 17, kamrer v. Trelleb:-kont. s. å., förste kassör v. Nord. Han-d :bankens Malmökont. 18, kassör v. Gbgs Hand :banks Falköp :kon’t. 25, kamrer 29, dir. o. led. av styr. 38. Rådman sed. 43. Lär. i bokför, v. Falköp. yrkessk. 28-35, led. av tax:nd 28-32, kronoomb. 33-35, stadsrev. 28-39. Res. t. Nordkap 34, Tyskl., Belg., Holl., Kanarieöarna 38, Tyskl., Ung. 39, Ital. o. Schw^eiz 48. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd Fellow, Sällsk. N. N. i Falköping.
translated: Åkesson, Nils Hjalmar, bank director, Falköping, b. 26/6/90 in Nevitshög, Malmöhus. 1., son of Åke Nilsson and Kerstin Jönsson. Married in 1918 to Kerstin Andersson, deceased in 1933. Children: Åke, born in 1920, law graduate. Completed high school in Lund in 1912. Employed at Skandinaviska Kredit AB from 1912-1917, at AB Industribanken from 1917, cashier at Trelleborg's branch office in the same year, chief cashier at Nordiska Handelsbanken's Malmö branch office in 1918, cashier at Göteborgs Handelsbank's Falköping branch office in 1925, promoted to chief cashier in 1929, director and board member since 1938. Appointed magistrate in 1943. Teacher of bookkeeping at Falköping Vocational School from 1928-1935, member of the tax board from 1928-1932, trustee of the crown from 1933-1935, city auditor from 1928-1939. Traveled to Nordkap in 1934, Germany, Belgium, the Canary Islands in 1938, Germany, Hungary in 1939, Italy and Switzerland in 1948. Member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellow, and the Society N. N. in Falköping.
